ProjectTitle: Development of KRAS/ PDE6D molecular glues to inhibit KRAS by nucleo-cytoplasmic sequestration
InitialFeedbackHistory: 05/07/2024 [REDACTED] will you use samples or materials? Please note that these are considered physical data in the context of a DMP, also list these the table and describe how you document, store and preserve them. [REDACTED] you use any human cells? [REDACTED] so please note that these are considered human bodily material, please register the use at the UZL ethical committee, for more information see: https://research.kuleuven.be/en/associatienet/ethics/guidance/humanmaterial [REDACTED] [REDACTED] preservation on external hard drives is not very save and secure, the KU [REDACTED] ICTS advises against this, but since you have a large volume of data I advise to contact your local IT team to find the best (and affordable) storage solution. https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en [REDACTED] for data that you share openly you can often select a license that tells others how they can use the data, e.g CC-BY meaning that the data is free to reuse but they will have to acknowledge/cite the creators, for more information see: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr/license-selection#Select 05/07/2024 [REDACTED] will you use samples or materials?
